about.description:
ABINIT is a software suite to calculate the optical, mechanical,
vibrational, and other observable properties of materials. Starting
from the quantum equations of density functional theory, you can
build up to advanced applications with perturbation theories based on
DFT, and many-body Green's functions (GW and DMFT) ...
about.summary: ABINIT is an atomic-scale simulation software suite.

name: abinit-data
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "abinit-data" %}
{% set version = "0.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/abinit-files/abinit-pseudopotentials-2.tar.gz
  sha256: fef025b3a00695e94651ae3a6a851b35af50836d8e8ce845061ff99dbefe093b

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  run_exports:
    - {{ pin_subpackage('abinit-data', max_pin='x.x.x') }}

requirements:
  build:
  run:

about:
  home: https://www.abinit.org
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: 'ABINIT is an atomic-scale simulation software suite.'

  description: |
    ABINIT is a software suite to calculate the optical, mechanical, 
    vibrational, and other observable properties of materials. Starting 
    from the quantum equations of density functional theory, you can 
    build up to advanced applications with perturbation theories based on 
    DFT, and many-body Green's functions (GW and DMFT) ...
  doc_url: https://wiki.abinit.org/doku.php
  dev_url: https://github.com/abinit/abinit/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen

about.description:
ABINIT is a software suite to calculate the optical, mechanical,
vibrational, and other observable properties of materials. Starting
from the quantum equations of density functional theory, you can
build up to advanced applications with perturbation theories based on
DFT, and many-body Green's functions (GW and DMFT) ...
about.summary: ABINIT is an atomic-scale simulation software suite.
